title: Brown Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 170g unsalted butter -room temperature or 1½ sticks (4 tbsp kept a side)
directions: 1) Preheat oven to 3502) In a medium bowl whisk the flour, baking powder, and baking soda3)Slice 4 tbsp of room temp butter and place in a large bowl.
Melt remaining 8 tbsp butter in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Brown the butter until dark abd golden (2-3 minutes)
Pour melted butter over room temp tbsp and stir until melted
Stir in granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla,and salt (rubber spatula) until combined
Wisk in the egg and yolk until combined (45 seconds) until smooth and glossy
Let batter sit 2-3 minutes and than wisk again 45 seconds
Pour flour kixture into bowl and use rubber spatula to combine (might take a minute to incorporate all dry ingredients)
Pour in chopped chocolate and use hands to knead in chocolate
Dough should be shiny, slick, dense, and will take a minute to fully incorporate chocolate
4) Form dough into balls - I did 50g and 60gPlace cookies on sheet pan with parchment paper
5)Bake one pan at a time. Bake until slightly golden brown. Start with 8-9 minutes should be no more than 14Sprinkle with salt6) Transfer fo wire rack and let cool
